reviews.review_msg: He set 30% (or 40%) for assignments. And there were just two sets of assignments. The questions were absolutely nonsense and funny. He himself even didn't know what his questions meant. He was totally unable to teach.

The most ridiculous course and professor. In the graduate level, at Game Theory, the whole time he was just practicing games like prisoners dilemma, chicken and Rock-paper-scissors, . . . and gave chocolates to the winners or volunteers!! Such a picnic!!
